Package fr.univparis.metro

Class BouarahAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
fr.univparis.metro.BouarahAlgorithm
public class BouarahAlgorithm
extends Object
Functional class that can be used to find the shortest path in a WGraph. The shortest path will be found also with the minimum possible correspondances. Correspondances will be express in a BiPredicate

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    BouarahAlgorithm()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static <T> void shortestPath​(WGraph<T> graph, T start, int limit, BiPredicate<T,​T> equivalenceRelation, HashMap<Pair<T,​Integer>,​Pair<T,​Integer>> prev, HashMap<Pair<T,​Integer>,​Double> dist)
    Find the shortest path with a limit on the number of transitions between equivalence classes.

  • Constructor Details

    • BouarahAlgorithm

      public BouarahAlgorithm()

  • Method Details

    • shortestPath

      public static <T> void shortestPath​(WGraph<T> graph, T start, int limit, BiPredicate<T,​T> equivalenceRelation, HashMap<Pair<T,​Integer>,​Pair<T,​Integer>> prev, HashMap<Pair<T,​Integer>,​Double> dist)
      Find the shortest path with a limit on the number of transitions between equivalence classes. Each vertex of the graph is associated with an integer k going from 0 to limit, so (V,5) mean vertex V with exactly 5 transitions. As a result, the number of vertices is multiplied by (limit+1).
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of vertices
      Parameters:
      graph - A weighted and oriented graph
      start - The starting vertex for research
      limit - The number of transitions allowed between equivalence classes
      equivalenceRelation - An equivalence relation i.e. a binary relation that is reflexive, symmetric and transitive
      prev - A HashMap associating a pair (V,k) to a pair (W,i) where W is a neighbor of V and i==k iff W and V are in the same equivalence classes
      dist - A HashMap associating a pair (V,k) at its minimum distance from start
